metadata.title: CVE-2024-26841 on Ubuntu 24.04 LTS (noble) - medium
metadata.description:

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2024-26841` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1005-intel - 6.8.0-1001.6
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1003-oem - 6.8.0-1003.3
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1008-realtime - 6.8.0-1008.19
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux-intel package in noble, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '6.8.0-1001.6').
linux-oem-6.8 package in noble, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '6.8.0-1003.3').
linux-raspi-realtime package in noble is affected. An update containing the fix has been completed and is pending publication (note: '6.8.0-2002.2').
linux-realtime package in noble, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '6.8.0-1008.19').
